[[File:The Lord of the Rings Online - Firienfeld.jpg|thumb|250px|The Firienfeld in ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'']]
'''Firienfeld''' was what the [[Rohirrim]] called the flat upland of [[Dunharrow]]; a large grassy area for the encampment of soldiers and refuge-seekers.<ref>{{RK|V3}}</ref> [[Aragorn]] and the [[Grey Company]] passed through the Firienfeld on [[8 March]] {{TA|3019}}; King [[Théoden]] and his riders arrived there the [[9 March|next day]].<ref>{{App|Great}}</ref>

==Etymology==
Firien represents [[Old English]] ''firgen'', "mountain"; ''-feld,'' means "field" and [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]] left it unmodernised; the Firienfield of the Index is in error.<ref>{{HM|N}}, p. 770</ref>

==Portrayal in adaptations==
'''2013: ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'':'''
:The Firienfeld sits atop the Dunharrow plateau, but has relatively little quest involvement as the player does not participate in the Muster of Rohan but rather is investigating activities of [[White Mountains]] orcs in the area.
